context: The patient had tympanoplasty surgery for a traumatic perforation of the right ear about six weeks ago.

text: his other ear was bothering him
context: Mom called because his other ear was bothering him
Mom called because his other ear was bothering him. Earlier today, he said it was ringing and vibrating. Now he says it does not hurt.

text: He has had a cold but it has not been severe
context: He has had a cold but it has not been severe

text: The right eardrum is intact showing a successful tympanoplasty.
context: I cleaned a little wax from the external meatus. The right eardrum might be very slightly red but not obviously infected.

text: The left eardrum (not the surgical ear) has a definite infection
context: The left eardrum (not the surgical ear) has a definite infection with a reddened bulging drum but no perforation or granulation tissue. Also some wax at the external meatus I cleaned with a Q-tip with peroxide.

text: Since he recently had a course of Omnicef we chose to put him on Augmentin
context: The patient has no medical allergies. Since he recently had a course of Omnicef we chose to put him on Augmentin (I checked and we did not have samples), so I phoned in a two-week course of Augmentin 400 mg chewable twice daily with food at Walgreens. If there is any ear drainage, please use the Floxin drops.
I looked at this throat which looks clear. The nose only has a little clear mucinous secretions.

text: check the ears again in about two weeks
context: I asked Mom to have the family doctor (or Dad, or me) check the ears again in about two weeks from now to be sure there is no residual infection. I plan to see the patient again later this spring.
